page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: HYTHE - The prominent feature of Hythe is the pier.It was built approximately 100 years ago by some landowners. It enables ferries to cross over to Southampton. Originally only walk could use it. In 1922 an electrified railway was added. There's also a typical High Street. St John's Church is also there, built in the 1840's. A Marina Village is now being built, due to finish in 1990. DIBDEN - At Dibden there's a scattered parish fronting onto Southampton Water whose main interest to the visitor is the Parish Church of All Saints which dates back to the 12th century. It was damaged by an airraid during the war, but has now been beautifully restored and still fulfils its functions to the locality. DIBDEN PURLIEU is a modern residential area with admirable shopping facilities close to the forest.
